name: St. Marie of the Incarnation

locations.description: Ursuline nun and missionary, founded first school for girls in New France

summary: Marie of the Incarnation was a French Ursuline nun who founded the first school for girls in New France (Quebec). She learned indigenous languages and worked to educate both French and Native American girls. She wrote extensively about her mystical experiences and the early history of New France. She is considered one of the most important figures in the early Catholic Church in Canada.
